step1.sentence: She left her corporate job to pursue a dream of opening her own bakery.

step2.story: After years of working in finance, Marcus finally decided to pursue a dream he had held since childhood. He enrolled in a culinary school and spent his evenings learning to cook. His colleagues thought he was crazy, but Marcus had never felt more alive.

step3.story: Elena had always painted in secret, hiding her canvases under her bed and sketching during lunch breaks. When her company announced layoffs, she saw it not as a crisis but as a sign. She decided it was finally time to pursue a dream she had been postponing for over a decade. With her savings and a small studio apartment, she set up a makeshift art space and began painting seriously for the first time. Months passed with little income, and doubt crept in on the harder days. But one morning, a gallery owner discovered her work online and offered her a show — proof that the leap had been worth taking.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 꿈을 쫓다, 즉 자신이 강하게 바라는 목표나 열망을 향해 적극적으로 나아가다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 단순히 꿈을 꾸는 것을 넘어 실제 행동으로 옮기는 과정을 강조할 때 쓰이며, 진로 변경·창업·예술 활동 등 개인적 열정을 추구하는 맥락에서 자주 등장한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'pursue'는 라틴어 'prosequi(앞으로 따라가다)'에서 유래했으며, 'dream'은 고대 영어 'drēam(기쁨, 환상)'에서 비롯되어 현대에는 '이루고 싶은 소망'을 뜻하게 되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 도전과 희생을 감수하면서도 가치 있는 목표를 향해 나아간다는 긍정적이고 용감한 뉘앙스를 담고 있으며, 격려나 영감을 주는 문맥에서 자주 사용된다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He moved to New York to pursue a dream of becoming a Broadway actor.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 브로드웨이 배우가 되겠다는 꿈을 추구하기 위해 뉴욕으로 이사했다.
